page.title: 13QUARRYING, HAILES
page.content: The area contains two quarries, both working the oolitic limestone. These are to be found at grid reference 079 301 and at 073 290. The stone extracted from the quarries is used predominantly in the construction of houses and for the building of walls. Planning restrictions in many parts of the Cotswolds are still rigid, and local stone must be used in new building. Both quarries are small scale enterprises. Each produces some 250000 tonnes of stone annually, employing a labour force of about a dozen men. The supply of stone is enormous. The main constraint on future expansion is the problem of the visual intrusion which such quarries make into the Cotswold landscape.
